stem: A 32-year-old postpartum client is receiving a Magnesium Sulfate infusion for severe preeclampsia. Based on the documentation in the Magnesium Infusion & Neuro Assessment Log, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Routine hourly assessment of Magnesium infusion.
Background: Severe preeclampsia; G1P1. Infusion rate 2g/hr.
Assessment: Client is difficult to rouse and slow to respond. Respiration rate is dropping.
Recommendation: Assess for toxicity.

tabs.title: Magnesium Infusion & Neuro Assessment Log
tabs.content:
Assessment Item08:00 (Previous)09:00 (Now)
Deep Tendon Reflexes (DTR)2+ (Normal)0 (Absent)
Respiratory Rate168 (Shallow)
Urine Output (Last Hour)45 mL15 mL
Serum Mag LevelN/A (Pending)9.2 mEq/L

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: BP 142/92, HR 82, RR 8, SpO2 91% on room air.

actionOptions.text: Immediately stop the Magnesium Sulfate infusion
Administer Calcium Gluconate 1g IV as prescribed
Increase the IV fluid rate to flush the kidneys
Place the client in a Trendelenburg position

parameterOptions.text: Presence of protein in the urine (Dipstick)

rationale.correct: The client shows classic 'Early' signs of Magnesium Toxicity (c2): Absent reflexes (DTR 0), low respiratory rate (8), and oliguria (15 mL/hr). When urine output drops, Mag levels rise quickly. The nurse MUST stop the infusion (a1) and give the antidote Calcium Gluconate (a2). Monitoring RR (p1) and Urine Output (p2) is essential to prevent cardiac arrest.
clinicalPearls: Normal Mag: 1.5-2.5. Therapeutic Mag for Preeclampsia: 4.0-7.0. Toxic: > 8.0.
Mnemonic: B-U-R-P (B-Reflexes down. U-Urine down. R-Respirations down. P-Pulmonary edema).
Calcium Gluconate is the ONLY antidote.

questionTrap.trap: Calling the doctor before stopping the bag.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Patient safety FIRST. If the RR is 8, the nurse stops the drug immediately, THEN notifies the provider.

mnemonic.title: Magnesium BURP
mnemonic.expansion: B-Blood pressure (Low). U-Urine (Low). R-Respirations (Low). P-Patellar (DTR Absent).
